decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game with Eldrazi creatures and powerful spells that disrupt the opponent's strategy. It utilizes cards like All Is Dust and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to clear the board and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes mana acceleration with Eldrazi Temple and Talisman of Impulse to quickly cast high-cost Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Defiler and Devourer of Destiny. Through the Breach allows for surprise creature attacks, while cards like Ugin's Labyrinth and Sowing Mycospawn provide additional control elements to dominate the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage. By controlling the game with counterspells and removal, the deck aims to establish a dominant position on the battlefield before deploying powerful threats like Murktide Regent. The deck also utilizes card draw and graveyard interaction to maintain a steady stream of resources and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Orcish Bowmasters and Subtlety provides versatile answers to a variety of threats, allowing for adaptability in different matchups.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on utilizing a wide variety of aggressive creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. With the addition of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion, the deck gains an extra advantage. The deck includes powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, Fatal Push, and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and deal damage efficiently. By combining speed with disruption, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and secure a swift victory in the Modern format.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play cards with the Delve mechanic to quickly fill up the graveyard and enable powerful plays, such as casting Ox of Agonas or bringing back Detective's Phoenix. By using cards like Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore, the deck can quickly cycle through the deck and cheat out powerful threats like Hollow One. Additionally, the deck utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to control the board while applying pressure. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and graveyard recursion.

The deck focuses on using cycling creatures and spells in order to manipulate the graveyard and control the board by casting Living End to bring back a large number of creatures, overwhelming the opponent and setting up powerful combos. The deck also includes disruptive spells to control the opponent's actions and protect its own game plan, making it a versatile and strategic option for Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. The deck aims to control the pace of the game by countering key spells, removing threats efficiently, and generating card advantage with cards like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog. By efficiently answering threats and maintaining card advantage, the deck can outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in the long game, ultimately securing victory through careful control of the game state.

The deck focuses on quickly building a wide board presence with aggressive creatures like Amped Raptor, Ragavan, and Guide of Souls, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Lightning Bolt, Blood Moon, and Chained to the Rocks. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggro plan, backed up by versatile removal and disruption options. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion provides additional value and flexibility to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using powerful Eldrazi creatures and spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes removal options like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble, while also providing ramp with Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse. The deck aims to reach the late game where it can drop game-winning threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also includes a few utility lands like Cavern of Souls and Kessig Wolf Run to support its game plan. Overall, the deck is designed to dominate the battlefield and out value the opponent.
